text:
When configuring and making apache a second time from the same source
distribution with a different destination directory (./configure
--prefix=PREFIX), the path for httpd.conf remains unchanged unless the build
tree is being cleaned in advance. This is confusing, since while configuring
apache again with a different prefix one expects the prefix to get incorporated
into the new installation (which is perfectly true for everything else being
subject to a new installation).
Example: this problem can occur, when a new module is required and should be
compiled into the installation, but the current installation should remain
untouched to allow for a fallback.
Issuing a "make clean" before starting configure and make solves the problem,
but this is not really intuitive.
creator: ulf.pietruschka@etenso.com

text:
It is standard practice to "make clean" after re-running configure; it would not
be worth the increase in buildsystem complexity to avoid this (having some dummy
dependency on which every object depends, or something).
creator: jorton@redhat.com
